item.title: About
item.description: The Choraliers started in 1978 as a choral class as part of the “Older Adult Studies” program at De Anza College. The first director was Joan Lomax. The class met at the Cupertino Senior Center and generally kept the same schedule as De Anza College. Joan Lomax retired in the fall of 1997. Laura Green started directing the class in the fall of 1998. In the summer of 2004, De Anza College terminated the Older Adult Studies program because of funding priorities, and in the fall of 2004 the Choraliers was formed as an independent organization with ties to the Fun Times Singers.

item.title: Web Links
item.description: Learning tracks for all Choraliers music. http://funtimessingers.org/index.php?p=cf

item.title: Chorus & Group Photos
item.description: The Choraliers in 2016 Chocolatiers The Chorus during rehearsal in Quinlan Community Center

item.title: Director Bio
item.description: Director: Laura Green Laura Green is a composer, choral conductor, Suzuki piano teacher, freelance pianist, and church organist. Laura is also one-half of a Flute and Piano Duo, the other half is her sister, Allison. Together they play for parties, weddings and corporate events. Laura directed the Fun Times Singers from 2002 to 2008. Now Laura directs the Choraliers, a group of Seniors (40 people) who provide sing-a-longs for retirement facilities and rest homes.

item.title: Shows & Performances
item.description: The Choraliers produce a public performance every two or three years, the next performance will be in 2019 or 2020. During the year the Choraliers perform at nursing homes, convalescent homes and retirement homes, these are not public performances.. The new quarter starts on Monday, January 4th Please note that all rehearsals will be held at St. Jude’s Episcopal Church 20920 McClellan Road Cupertino, CA 95014 408-252-4166 Winter season 2019

item.title: Meetings
item.description: The Cupertino Choraliers normally meet at St. Jude’s Episcopal Church 20920 McClellan Road Cupertino, CA 95014 Every Monday morning at 10:00 AM The meetings are split up into 4 Quarters. Winter January to March, Fee $40.00 plus Music. Spring April to June, Fee $25.00 No new Music. Summer July to September, Fee $40.00 plus Music. Fall October to December, Fee $40.00 plus Music. During the Fall Quarter we perform Christmas Music.

item.title: Summer News
item.description: This where periodic news updates can go. Technical stuff below. Below are some examples of Markdown to see how it is rendered in the browser. http://example.org/posts/ H1 H2 H3 H4 H5 H6 Alternatively, for H1 and H2, an underline-ish style: Alt-H1 Alt-H2 Emphasis, aka italics, with asterisks or underscores. Strong emphasis, aka bold, with asterisks or underscores. Combined emphasis with asterisks and underscores. Strikethrough uses two tildes. Scratch this.
